name: 尤信程
objective: This course covers a broad classes of machine learning algorithms to be able to conduct research in this field after completing this course. The emphasis of this course is not in the theoretical development (math), but in the understanding level. Therefore, many examples will be given in the lecture to show how to apply the equations to real problems. The detailed contents are given in the course schedule field.
schedule:
Week 1: Class announcement and introduction to machine learning (CH 1)
Week 2: Holiday
Week 3: Basics of supervised learning (Example: k-NN), VC dimension, and regression (CH 2). Bayesian decision theory (CH 3) and Naive Bayes classifiers (CH 5) 
Week 4: ML and MAP estimation; Bias vs variance dilemma (CH 4). Sample mean mean and sample covariance (CH 5). Dimension reduction techniques: PCA, FA (CH 6)
Week 5: Dimension reduction techniques: LDA and ICA. Clustering algorithm: k-mean (CH 7)
Week 6: Unsupervised neural networks (CH 12): Competitive learning, SOFM, and ART. Decision trees: ID3, C4.5, and random forest (CH 8)
Week 7: Holiday
Week 8: Basics of optimization.
Week 9: MT
Week 10: MT sol. Gradient search and linear discrimination (CH 10)
Week 11: Feedforward neural networks with examples: radical basis networks and multi-layer perceptrons. Back propagation and regularization methods (CH 11)
Week 12: Deep learning and convolutional neural networks
Week 13: More on deep neural networks: YOLO, Autoencoder, LSTM, and others 
Week 14: SVM (CH 13)
Week 15: Combining multiple classifiers (CH 17) & Design and analysis of experiments (CH 19) 
Week 16: Reinforcement learning (Basics, Q learning, DQN)
Week 17: Reinforcement learning (policy-based learning & PPO)
Week 18: Final exam
materials: Reference text book: Introduction to machine learning. E. Alpaydin. 2nd ed or 3rd ed. Note: textbook is only used to follow the presentation order. Much of the detailed lecture materials are NOT covered in the textbook.
